subject: PLDM: oem-ibm: detect max xdma buffer size
commitMessage:
PLDM: oem-ibm: detect max xdma buffer size

Remove the max size that is hard coded for DMA's as it does not
work with multiple platforms. To fix this, if mmap of page aligned
length fails, divide by 2 and attempt to mmap again. Keep doing
till mmap succeeds.

Change-Id: Ia341ea9362024519eaec4444edc8f0b8ec119509
Signed-off-by: vkaverap <vkaverap@in.ibm.com>

Removed reviewer Tom Joseph with the following votes:

* Code-Review+1 by Tom Joseph <rushtotom@gmail.com>
This can be handled by an helper API, which can take a passed in length and return the size of the alignedLength.
I will prefer a better variable name, very confusing trying to read the code.

1) With this logic only newLength will be DMA'ed instead of pageAlignedLength.

2) As per the comment on the issue https://github.com/ibm-openbmc/dev/issues/1661#issuecomment-581199493, only one mmap of pageAlignedLength is needed and not for every chunks.
The getPageAlignedLength at line no #53 already aligns length to pagesize, lengthTemp/2 will be a multiple of pageSize , so do we need  the call here?
The whole length cannot be guaranteed to be transferred because pageAlignedLength can be less than the "length". Would we not need multiple DMA operations to achieve transferring"length" bytes?
How is this different from the function declared at line no #57? either documentation or naming it differently.
The first function does only mmap of the length. This function does the rest of transfer data and write. This is split to two function to give more clarity.
Probably this can be removed in the next patch.
Can we do iterations of pageAlignedLength instead of lengthTemp?
This function is returning PLDM_ERROR instead of errno
Both the functions are named same transferDataHost, which creates confusion.
Why is this moved to the header file?
This is not true as per the commit, can you update the commit message.
